pr_title: [Transform] Handle multi-fields properly when creating destination index.

timeline.bodyText:
Tests show this doesn't work when there are object fields mixed with multi-fields.
I need to rethink this solution.
timeline.author: przemekwitek

replies.bodyText:
Ok, I've fixed it.
Still, I have the impression that there should be an easier way of reconciling individual mappings into the new index creation request. But that's what I have for now.
replies.author: przemekwitek

timeline.message:
Fix failing unit test
Simplify "diveInto" method by using "computeIfAbsent"

timeline.bodyText: nit: I am not a big fan of using regex if there is no reason. Arguably its java's fault. A potential alternative: the tokenize methods in org.elasticsearch.common.Strings
timeline.author: hendrikmuhs

replies.bodyText:
Arguably its java's fault.

Unfortunately I couldn't find a non-regex version of split() method.

A potential alternative: the tokenize methods in org.elasticsearch.common.Strings

Thanks! I've used Strings.tokenizeToStringArray method.
replies.author: przemekwitek

timeline.message: Handle multi-fields properly when creating destination index.
Handle "object" and "nested" mappings when constructing transform's destination index mappings
Emit explicit { "type": "object" } entries and fix test

Fix failing unit test
Simplify "diveInto" method by using "computeIfAbsent"
